# Periods of English Literature
- **Mnemonic:** \banglatext{অমি রান্না নিয়ে রুমি ভাই এর মন পেল}
	- Old age / Anglo-Saxon period
	- Middle age
	- Renaissance
	- Neoclassical
	- Romantic
	- Victorian
	- Edwardian
	- Modern
	- Postmodern / contemporary

# Old English (450-1066)
- Most famous work: **Beowulf**
	- Epic poem
	- Author was anonymous
	- **$\boldsymbol\approx \textbf{3200}$ lines**
- Famous author: **Caedmon**
	- Earliest known English poet
	- Sole surviving work: **Caedmon's Hymn** (poem)


# Middle English (1066-1500)
\fbox{\parbox{.9\textwidth}{\textbf{Famous authors:}
\begin{itemize}
 \item \textbf{Geoffrey Chaucer} aka \textit{father of English poetry}
 \item Thomas Malory
 \item Robert Henryson

\end{itemize}	
}}

# Renaissance (1500-1660)
- **4 subperiods:**
	- **Mnemonic:** \banglatext{লিজা যাবে} car-\banglatext{এ করে} 
- **Elizabethan** (1558-1603)
	- Replete with lyrics and songs
	- **Golden age of English drama/literature**
	- **Famous authors:**
		- Mnemonic: \banglatext{লিলি মার সাথে ফ্রান্স স্পেনে ঘুরছে}
		- Christopher Marlowe and other _"University Wits"_:
			- Robert Greene
			- Thomas Nashe
			- Thomas Lodge
			- George Peele
			- John Lyly
		- Shakespeare
		- Francis Bacon
		- Edmund Spenser
		- John Lyly
- **Jacobean** (1603-1625)
	- Reign of James I $\rightarrow$ Jacobean era
	- **Famous authors:**
		- John Donne
		- Michael Drayton
		- Ben Johnson
		- Elizabeth Cary
- **Caroline** (1625-1649)
	- Reign of Charles I ("Carolus") $\rightarrow$ Caroline era
	- **Famous authors:**
		- John Milton
		- Robert Burton
		- George Herbert
- **Commonwealth** (1650-1660)
	- John Milton
	- Thomas Hobbes
	- Thomas Fuller
	- Abraham Cowley
	- Andrew Marvell

# Neoclassical (1660-1785)
- **3 subperiods**
- **Restoration** (1660-1700)
	- William Congreve
	- John Dryden (Congreve and Dryden known for _restoration comedies_)
	- Samuel Butler (_satire_)
	- John Bunyan
	- John Locke
- **Augustan** (1700-1745)
	- Alexander Pope
	- Jonathan Swift
- **Sensibility / Johnson** (1745-1785)
	- Henry Fielding
	- Edmund Burke
	- Edward Gibbon
	- Samuel Johnson
	- Samuel Richardson
	- Hester Lynch Thrale
	- James Boswell
	- Tobias Smollett
	- Laurence Sterne
	- William Cowper
	- Thomas Perry

# Romantic (1800-1832)
- Wordsworth
- Coleridge
- Keats
- Blake
- Shelley (Percy Bysshe and Mary)
- Byron
- Jane Austen
- Charles Lamb

	\item Matthew Arnold

\end{itemize}
}}

\fbox{\parbox{.9\textwidth}{\textbf{Essayists:}

}}

\fbox{\parbox{.9\textwidth}{\textbf{Novelists:}

# Middle English Period
\blockhead{Geoffrey Chaucer}

- Notable works:
	- The Canterbury Tales
	- The Nun Priest's Tale
	- The Parliament of Fowls
	- The Legend of Good Women

\blockhead{John Wycliffe}

- English theologian, philosopher etc
- **First translated the Bible from Latin**
- **"Father of English Prose"**

# Elizabethan Period
\blockhead{Edmund Spenser}

- **"Poet of poets"**
- Famous poems:
	- The Faerie Queen (epic)
	- Amoretti (sonnets)
	- Colin Clouts Came Home Again
	- Mother Hubberd's Tale
	- Complaints
	- Epithalamion
	- The Shepherd's Calendar


\blockhead{Christopher Marlowe}

- "Shakespeare's most important predecessor"
- "Greatest dramatist before Shakespeare"
- **Father of English tragedy**
- Notable works:

\vspace{3mm}
\begin{columns}[t, totalwidth=\textwidth]
	\column{.45\textwidth}
	\fbox{\parbox{.9\textwidth}{
		\footnotesize
		\textbf{Plays:}
		\begin{itemize}
			\tightlist
			\item Dr Faustus
			\item The Jew of Malta
			\item You Can Never Tell
			\item Tamburlaine the Great
		\end{itemize}
		\normalsize
	}}
	\column{.45\textwidth}
	\fbox{\parbox{.9\textwidth}{
		\footnotesize
		\textbf{Poetry:}
			\begin{itemize}
				\tightlist
				\item Pharsalia
				\item The Passionate Shepherd to His Love
				\item Amores
			\end{itemize}
		\normalsize
	}}
\end{columns}


\blockhead{Shakespeare}

- Birth: 1564, Death: 1616
- 37 plays, 154 sonnets

\blockhead{John Lyly}

- Notable works:
	- Euphues ("bears the embryo of English novel")
	- Campaspe
	- Sapho and Phao
	- Midas
